tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In the days of the prophets, this destruction was made manifest in the present world, as for their successors it will become a reality in the Hereafter
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What insight does the explanation provide about this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The present world has been made with a view to putting human beings to the test. When the period of testing is over, this world will be demolished and a new world fashioned to meet new requirements will be made
distractors: This verse only discusses worldly matters
This verse is primarily about historical events
This verse focuses on scientific facts

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In the world of the Hereafter, success is the fate of one who in the present world never ceases to fear God, whereas one who lives his life in this world without such fear and is arrogant towards the subjects of God will be affected with the severest punishment in the Hereafter
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Al-Haqqah, Ayah 38?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Neither the present available knowledge contradicts the Quran being the Truth, nor will future knowledge be able to do so. It literally means, ‘whatever you see and whatever you do not see bear testimony to the veracity of this discourse’ that is, whatever knowledge was at the command of humanity...
distractors: This verse narrates a historical event
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
